Articles.Content: D: It's official. My computer has admitted to me that it lacks the memory to play KSP. Sigh I hate Windows XP... Can somebody help me out? If I dont get back on KSP... its gonna be like a grown man without coffee!
How much do you have sneezedr424, and do you have a swap file?
:l Where do I find my RAM and stuff like that?

On XP you can rightclick the My Computer icon and select properties, one of the tabs in the resulting box will show your RAM.

Alternatively you can click Start, click Run and type in dxdiag, then press enter, this will give you the nifty Windows system diagnostic utility.
oh. I got 448 megabytes of RAM, but idk what a swap file is.

oh. I got 448 megabytes of RAM, but idk what a swap file is.

Wow. That's just enough to run XP, never mind much of anything else. I know, I used to play Minecraft on a XP machine

Well, that is not a lot, like you said XP has told you it didn't have enough RAM, and it wasn't lying.

You can try making a swap file (also called a page file on XP) by following these instructions, it'll be slow, and I can't guarantee it'll get KSP working at all, but it's worth a shot.

Also, shut down all non essential programs, even the antivirus, just don't go downloading anything with it off.

And don't run KSP from the Desktop, use C:\Games it'll help a little.
alright, I'll try that, and report back

K so I opened up the Size window and it tells me this:

Minimum allowed: 2 MB

Reccomended: 670 MB

Currently Allocated: 1339 MB

What do YOU, as a moderator, reccomend?

For the Initial and Maximum sizes, I mean.

KSP 's recommended minimum is 2gigs of RAM, so I'd bump that up to a minimum of 1600mb.

But if you want my actual recommendation, it would be to upgrade your RAM or use a better computer, I am assuming it is not very powerful, has limited graphics support and an old processor, I'd have to see your dxdiag output to be sure though.

Ideally you'd have 2 gigabytes of RAM, which is considered low these days and most entry level PC's have more as standard, you'd also have an Nvidia or an ATI graphics card, it doesn't even have to be top of the range.

Just about any entry level PC you can buy these days will also have a multi core processor, KSP doesnt need it but it makes it easier to run several programs at once, and you'd be hard pressed to find a new PC that didn't have a 64bit operating system installed, basically you won't find a new PC with 448mb of RAM, the technology has moved on.

I hate to say it but your PC might just be too old.

Try the swap/page file thing though, it's worth a go at least.
Alright then. Thanks so much! I really apreciate it.
Yeah, KSP is only going to get more memory intensive as it develops and more things are added so you'll very likely need an upgrade sooner or later if you want to keep playing the new revisions.
Hoping to get a good gaming PC soon
